Other car owners weren’t as fortunate, but hopefully their insurance and/or the shop’s insurance will step up. Sadly,money can’t bring back rare, customized vehicles. Fire officials said several of the cars which were destroyed in the fire were Corvettes, but they didn’t specify model years or any other information about them. If not for the hard work of those responding fire crews, it sounds like many more vehicles would’ve been lost as well as the entire building. Fortunately that wasn’t the case.
The cause of the fire is still under investigation. It originated in a car prep area located near the paint booth.

According to Auto Concepts of the Carolinas’ website, the shop caters to customers who want to customize and increase performance for their vehicle. It offers restoration services and creates restomods, pro-touring cars, etc. for everything from muscle cars to off-roaders. A local news report says the owner, Jesse Walker, has a stellar reputation among enthusiasts in the area.
